justification: The paper mentions that the IEQ was used to describe and measure intersession processes comprehensively, validating the psychometric structure of ISP in independent samples.

The SIPS, a ten-item scale developed for ambulatory assessment studies, was specifically used in this study to measure various aspects of intersession processes. It allows for single-item interpretation and was employed for daily measurements.

The PHQ-9, a nine-item questionnaire, was used for daily measurement of symptom stress associated with depression. It has been utilized successfully in previous studies and is well-validated for assessing major depression.
The GAD-7 was used for daily assessment of anxiety symptoms. It is a short measure with good psychometric quality and has successfully been employed with various anxiety disorders.
The SAD-D is a ten-item severity measure developed based on DSM-5 criteria, used here to assess cognitive, behavioral, and affective symptoms of social anxiety disorder.
